item.title: Interactive graphs with plotly and ggvis
item.description: Purpose There are two very powerful packages in R to make interactive graphics: plotly and ggvis. In this post I put together some examples to explore their capabilities and limitations. And I consider some of the differences. plotly Plotly is an ‘interactive, browser-based charting library built on the open source JavaScript graphing library plotly.js’. Or more conceptually, plotly is a data visualization toolbox built from JSON objects, with interfaces to work with Scala, R, Python, or Matlab.
